snippet: The gap between Americans who view the Affordable Care Act favorably and those who do not is smaller than at any time since 2012, according to a Kaiser Family Foundation poll.
abstract: Kaiser Health Tracking Poll finds 43 percent of respondents have unfavorable view of Affordable Care Act while 41 percent view it favorably, smallest gap between two sides since fall of 2012; also finds majority of respondents worry about Supreme Court case that could limit health insurance subsidies.
lead_paragraph: The gap between Americans who view the Affordable Care Act favorably and those who do not is smaller than at any time since 2012, according to a Kaiser Family Foundation poll.

headline.main: Poll on Health Care Law Shows Increased Support
headline.print_headline: Poll on Health Care Law Shows Increased Support After Smooth Enrollment Period

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
